Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part palmette with added white petals and added red centre; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: 'AO' is written in pencil on the interior surface. According to Williams (1983, 169), cups with painted inscription are kantharoi, however, the typical interior decoration on Type B1 kantharoi are lotus flowers and lotus buds. The palmette is not a typical motif for these vessels but is commonly found on chalices. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 190)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 731, no. 913)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1703) (phase 2)
